title: Myleene Klass shares a series of snaps doting over baby son Apollo with partner Simon Motson
text:
She welcomed their first child together, a son named Apollo, in August.

And Myleene Klass looked every inch the glowing mother as she shared a series of snaps with her tot and partner Simon Motson.

The presenter, 41, posted a snap of herself holding Apollo while Simon stood behind with his arms wrapped lovingly around her.

Family: Myleene Klass looked every inch the glowing mother as she shared a series of snaps with her son Apollo and partner Simon Motson

Myleene was dressed casually in the snap in a black jumper and green tracksuit bottoms as the couple posed on a balcony with an idyllic sea view behind them.

In another snap, uploaded to her Instagram Stories, the TV star held Apollo up in her arms and gazed at him as the sun set behind them.

Myleene recently posted a photo of herself enjoying a boat trip with Apollo where she cut a stylish figure in a black v-neck top and a pair of large shades.

Letting her brunette locks fall loose down her shoulders, the former Hear'Say singer also sported a pair of hoop earrings.

Cute: In another snap, uploaded to her Instagram Stories, the TV star held Apollo up in her arms and gazed at him as the sun set behind them

It comes after Myleene spoke about her 'blended family' with partner Simon after becoming a stepmother to his two children.

The TV host admitted she never imagined 'navigating the complexities of a blended family' but that the 'love is very special'.

Myleene wrote: '4 years ago, I met Sim. We had both been through pretty identical experiences with regards to our personal lives. We came to our relationship with two children each.

'Today, we have a son together and five children between us! Navigating the complexities of a blended family is something I never imagined myself doing.

Sweet: Myleene recently posted a photo of herself enjoying a boat trip with Apollo where she cut a stylish figure in a black v-neck top and a pair of large shades

'Becoming a Stepmum, laying out four school uniforms in the morning, teaching extra piano lessons, feeding an army, learning to balance family life, attempting to keep things "fair and equal" between five very different children, plus navigating the new dynamics every day brings, the ‘mine, yours and ours’,....the sense of achievement when it all goes well not to mention the love is very special indeed.

'Families come in all shapes and sizes, mine just happens to be fabulously blended...and big!

'As everyone knows, no family, blended or otherwise is perfect but I am so proud of what Sim, myself and our children try to achieve every single day.'

Family: Myleene recently spoke about her 'blended family' with partner Simon (pictured together in May 2019)

Myleene, who is also mother is to Ava, 12, and Hero, eight, also spoke more about her family life on the Independent's Millennial Love podcast.

She explained that her and Simon's children are the same ages, meaning they have two eight-year-olds and two 12-year-olds, which is a 'gift in many ways'.

Myleene said: 'You have an idea where everyone's at, interests, even borrowing clothes - but it can be very tricky because the level of competitiveness is the same.'

Since blending their families four years ago, the children have become good friends with the Hero and Sim's daughter who is nicknamed Leeny even calling themselves 'the twinnies'.

Revealing: The presenter explained how her life has changed since becoming a stepmother

They've grown so close that Myleene said even when she plans for everyone to have their own space the children end up together.

She said they always end up in the same space and it's as if the children almost didn't want to be separate and wanted to be 'part of the unit'.

The broadcaster explained that becoming a stepmother was something she had never imagined doing, but that raising them is simple as it comes down to love.

She said: 'You have to be pretty selfless to be a parent, and then to be a step parent - even more so.

'I never knew I could be this selfless, I mean 20 years ago I was a pop star and it was all about me. But it's quite simple with children, they just want to be loved.'
